page.title: 16Education in Milton Ernest
page.content: {Milton Ernest School}was founded to provide education "according to the principals and practice of the Church of England".It is legally owned by the Trustees of its Church of England Foundation but it is controlled by the Local Education Authority, which accepts full financial responsibility for its maintenance. At the age of 9+ the children transfer from the{Lower}to the{Middle School and at 13+ they transfer to the{Upper {School}where they remain until they attain 16 or 18 years of age. Following a survey of{Milton Ernest and{Radwell}it was found that one third of the families with children of school age choose to send one or more children to a private school. Two thirds of the families send their children to a state school. There is a local private pre-school Nursery unit.
